content: stitch as first double_crochet close round with slip_stitch in 1st double_crochet > 54 double_crochet size m only pull the active loop open pass the ball of yarn through and pull the loop tight to secure the yarn skip round 5 and continue with round 6 round 5 size l only ch3 =1st double_crochet * 1 double_crochet in each of next 2 stitches 2 double_crochet in following stitch repeat from * 16 more times until 2 stitches are left end round with 1 double_crochet in each of last two stitches 1 double_crochet in same stitch as first double_crochet close round with slip_stitch in 1st double_crochet break yarn if you want to use a different color for the peel otherwise secure yarn by pulling yarn ball through the loop > 72 double_crochet copyright susanne vetterkind you may spread the fun by sharing the pattern and you may make as many zesty citrus coasters as you like but please for personal use only enjoy zesty citrus coasters all sizes round 6 continue with white yarn make sure not to pull too tight - let yarn travel up loosely on backside of work ch2 = 1st esc *5 8 11 esc 2 esc in the next stitch repeat from * 4 more times finish round with 5 8 11 esc and one esc in the same stitch as 1st esc close round with slip_stitch in 1st esc break yarn and pull through loop to fasten > 42 60 78 esc round 7 pick up fruit color if you want a different peel color for the grapefruit attach new yarn ch1 then work one round of single_crochet without increases finish round with slip_stitch in 1st stitch of the round break yarn > 42 60 78 single_crochet second half of coaster make an identical circle for the second half but when breaking the yarn at the end leave yarn tails of about one or two yards for both white and fruit color for embroidering and sewing together sew two halves together place the two coaster halves backside to backside placing any yarn ends except the two long ends of course on the inside to hide them make sure the tips of the white stars in the middle align on both sides use a tapestry needle and the fruit color yarn to sew the two coaster halves together stitch by stitch just underneath the outermost loops weave in end embroidering and stabilizing in the last step the white pith between the citrus segments is embroidered onto the coasters this step also connects the two halves and stabilizes the coaster use a tapestry needle with the white yarn end and place two or three chain stitches towards the white star in the middle bring the thread to the next white tip and place two or three chain stitches towards the peel turn the work around and continue on the other side work two or three chain stitches back towards the center -
